article: the sar shahi camp for people displaced by the war , a vast checkerboard of tents extending as far as the eye can see , sits on a barren plateau of rocks and gravel and fries in the sweltering afghan sun like a skillet on a stove .
abstract: afghan refugees multiply as fighting continues
